isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk perl-LDAP

Vulnerability.Title: perl-LDAP bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description:
An update for perl-LDAP is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7. The perl-LDAP package provides a collection of modules that implements an LDAP services API for Perl programs. The modules can be used to search directories, or perform maintenance functions, such as adding, deleting, or modifying entries.
For detailed information on changes in this release, see the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.3 Release Notes linked from the References section.
Users of perl-LDAP are advised to upgrade to these updated packages.
Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
